channel.title: The Atomic MPC quote on the front page
channel.description:
Hello though this is my first time posting, I have been following Black Mesa Source for two years. I do reviews of [url='https://imbacore.blogspot.com/search/label/Free%20FPS']freeware games[/url] as a hobby so your project interests me immensely.
I would like to point out though that the Atomic MPC quote on the front page ("one massive, jawdropping session") is quite misleading. IMHO, I don't think that the Atomic MPC writer was referring to your project; he was referring to the original Half-Life as evidenced by the sentence that preceded the quote in question: [quote] It's one of those things that many people can remember perfectly, including what they were doing when they first played, where they were - we were writing a preview for PC Authority when we received the first 20 per cent of the finished game from then unknown developer Valve. [/quote] After this he writes: [quote] And we finished it one massive, jawdropping session. [/quote] I hope this won't be misconstrued as an attack, just a concerned community member giving his two cents.
Just in case you're curious here are my Black Mesa: Source articles:
[url='https://imbacore.blogspot.com/2008/06/black-mesa-half-life-2-mod-half-life.html']Black Mesa: Source article 1 (June 6, 2008 )[/url][url='https://imbacore.blogspot.com/2009/01/half-life-2-mod-black-mesa-free-fps.html']Black Mesa: Source article 2 (January, 5 2009)[/url] [url='https://imbacore.blogspot.com/2009/11/site-update-review-downloadable-free-pc.html']Black Mesa: Source article 3 (November 1, 2009)[/url] [url='https://imbacore.blogspot.com/2010/09/two-half-life-2-mods-you-should-look.html']Black Mesa: Source article 4 (September 11, 2010)[/url]
Wishing you all the best in finishing the mod. (If memory serves there's a Deus Ex project that took 7 years to finish so the delay is understandable.)

item.title: The Atomic MPC quote on the front page
item.dc:creator: E-Nelson
item.description:
I’m pretty sure the Kotaku quote is a misquote as well.
“Black Mesa Trailer Is Some Hot Shit” != “Black Mesa is some hot shit”

Read full topic
item.source: The Atomic MPC quote on the front page

item.title: The Atomic MPC quote on the front page
item.dc:creator: Spooks
item.description:
Aw, I bet he just put it for the visual pun when the quote and the toilet landing image coincide.

But it’s funny, don’t go away, quote.

Read full topic
item.source: The Atomic MPC quote on the front page

although the only difference is that they only got to play 2 chapters

item.title: The Atomic MPC quote on the front page
item.dc:creator: ildamos
item.description:
Nicely spotted, I guess Josh didn’t read the article properly. I’ll see if I can get him to fix it up.

You’re welcome. Glad to help.

Read full topic

item.title: The Atomic MPC quote on the front page
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Good job, party pooper.

Hope your mom is proud.

Christ, some people…

item.title: The Atomic MPC quote on the front page
item.dc:creator: ildamos
item.description:
Hello though this is my first time posting, I have been following Black Mesa Source for two years. I do reviews of freeware games as a hobby so your project interests me immensely.

I would like to point out though that the Atomic MPC quote on the front page (“one massive, jawdropping session”) is quite misleading. IMHO, I don’t think that the Atomic MPC writer was referring to your project; he was referring to the original Half-Life as evidenced by the sentence that preceded the quote in question:

It’s one of those things that many people can remember perfectly, including what they were doing when they first played, where they were - we were writing a preview for PC Authority when we received the first 20 per cent of the finished game from then unknown developer Valve.

After this he writes:

And we finished it one massive, jawdropping session.

I hope this won’t be misconstrued as an attack, just a concerned community member giving his two cents.

Just in case you’re curious here are my Black Mesa: Source articles:

Black Mesa: Source article 1 (June 6, 2008 )Black Mesa: Source article 2 (January, 5 2009)
Black Mesa: Source article 3 (November 1, 2009)
Black Mesa: Source article 4 (September 11, 2010)

Wishing you all the best in finishing the mod. (If memory serves there’s a Deus Ex project that took 7 years to finish so the delay is understandable.)
